instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to classify pepper seed varieties?
Output: In the related study, the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum to classify pepper seed varieties.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to classify pepper seed varieties?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to classify pepper seed varieties were the full bands of the spectrum and the feature bands selected by successive projection algorithm (SPA).

instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in the classification of pepper seed varieties?
Output: The metric chosen was classification accuracy. It was able to achieve an accuracy of 85.81% using the KNN algorithm, 97.70% for the SVM algorithm, and 90.5% for the 1D-CNN algorithm in the testing set.

instruction: What were the results of using K nearest neighbors (KNN) and support vector machine (SVM) in the classification of pepper seed varieties using multispectral imaging and 1D-CNN?
Output:
The results of using K nearest neighbors (KNN) and support vector machine (SVM) in the classification of pepper seed varieties using multispectral imaging and 1D-CNN are as follows:

- With full bands of the spectrum, the classification accuracy of the KNN model was 85.81%, while the SVM model achieved a higher accuracy of 97.70%. The 1D-CNN model had a classification accuracy of 90.50%.

- When using feature bands selected by the successive projection algorithm (SPA), the testing accuracies of the SVM and 1D-CNN models were 97.30% and 92.6%, respectively.

Therefore, the SVM model performed slightly better than the 1D-CNN model in both cases, with full bands and feature bands.

instruction: Can the use of multispectral imaging combined with a one-dimensional convolutional neural network (1D-CNN) be considered a superior method for classifying pepper seed varieties compared to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, the use of multispectral imaging combined with a one-dimensional convolutional neural network (1D-CNN) can be considered a superior method for classifying pepper seed varieties compared to traditional methods. The related study found that the classification accuracy of the 1D-CNN model was 90.50% when using the full bands of the spectrum and 92.6% when using the feature bands selected by the successive projection algorithm (SPA). This indicates that the 1D-CNN model outperformed traditional methods such as K nearest neighbors (KNN) and support vector machine (SVM) in terms of accuracy. Additionally, the ease of operation of the 1D-CNN model made it the most feasible method for predicting pepper seed varieties.
